title: Miami knocks off Ohio St., marches on in CFP

title: Centre's Fiscal Deficit Crosses 62% Of Full-Year Budget Target In November
content: The Centre's fiscal deficit at the end of November stood at Rs 9.76 lakh crore, or 62.3 per cent of the annual budget target for 2025-26, compared to 52.5 per cent in the year-ago period, according to government data released on Wednesday.

content: The DESERT CYCLONE‚ÄìII exercise strengthened professional bonds between the two armies and contributed to the development of interoperable capabilities for future multinational operations

content: Excise Minister says the advertisement inviting the public to suggest a name and logo for the liquor brand was issued by Bevco and the govt. has no role in the decision

title: Stop serving lies to people and introspect, Nadda tells Kharge
content: Responding to the Congress‚Äôs allegations that the MGNREGA has been abolished, J.P. Nadda said the scheme was expanded by increasing working days to 125, ensuring payment within 15 days

content: The DRDO carried out a salvo launch of two indigenous Pralay missiles from the same launcher on December 31. The test was held off the coast of Odisha

content: In 10 days, around 42,000 chemist shops in T.N. will display the QR code¬†as per the instructions of Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation

content: The rules define workers, wages, types of employment, gratuity, bonus and social security of workers, including gig workers

title: No third party mediation during Operation Sindoor: government officials refute intervention claims by China and U.S.
content: After U.S. President Trump had made several such claims, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi recently said that Beijing had helped stop India-Pakistan conflict

title: Malayali priest, seven others get bail in conversion case
content: The priest was arrested following a complaint from members of VHP and the Bajrang Dal; the priest, his family and his associates had gone to Shingori to attend a prayer meet

title: Decade after GMR‚Äôs ouster, AAI to study Maldives plea to run airport
content: Following a request from the Maldives government, the Civil Aviation Ministry has asked AAI to study a proposal to engage Indian companies to manage the upgraded Hanimaadhoo airport

title: Swiss bar fire: 'Several dozens' feared dead, over 100 hurt; victims of many nationalities
content: An explosion tore through Le Constellation bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana during New Year's celebrations, killing several people and injuring others. Nearly 100 people were inside the popular tourist spot when the blast occurred shortly after midnight. Authorities have cordoned off the area and imposed a no-fly zone as emergency operations and investigations into the cause continue.

title: Faridabad gangrape case: Woman‚Äôs cries unheard on foggy, isolated road ‚Äî chilling details emerge
content: A 25-year-old woman endured a harrowing ordeal, allegedly gang-raped for nearly three hours inside a moving van on a fog-shrouded Gurgaon-Faridabad Road. Her cries for help went unheard due to the dense fog and isolation. Police have arrested two van drivers, with further identification procedures pending. The victim sustained severe injuries and is recovering.

title: Bullet train by 2027! Ashwini Vaishnaw reveals key routes ‚Äî Ahmedabad, Surat & more
content: India's first bullet train is slated for a 2027 launch, with the Surat to Bilimora section opening first.  The ambitious Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor, developed with Japan, promises speeds up to 320 kmph, drastically cutting travel time.  Additionally, the first Vande Bharat sleeper train will debut in January 2026, offering comfortable overnight journeys.

title: India, Pak exchange list of nuke sites: What is 1988 agreement? Explained
content: India and Pakistan have exchanged lists of their nuclear installations and facilities, marking the 35th consecutive annual update under a 1988 agreement. This routine exchange, continuing even during periods of tension, aims to prevent accidental or deliberate attacks on critical nuclear infrastructure, fostering predictability between the two nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Over 70 wishes to share ‚Äî images, quotes, status & more
content: As 2026 approaches, the article highlights the diverse ways people celebrate and express New Year's wishes. It emphasizes the value of simple, heartfelt messages, relatable quotes, and genuine status updates, alongside visual elements like images and wallpapers, to connect with loved ones during this transitional period.

title: California wealth tax debate: Musk on Tesla and SpaceX shares; ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs almost ...‚Äô
content: Elon Musk has joined the debate on California's proposed wealth tax, stating his fortune is tied to Tesla and SpaceX shares, not liquid assets. He argues his wealth grows by producing useful products, benefiting shareholders. Tech leaders warn the tax could drive entrepreneurs out of the state, impacting job creation and tax revenues.

title: Virat Kohli adds special emoji, posts picture with Anushka Sharma - See pic
content: Virat Kohli celebrated New Year's Day 2026 with wife Anushka Sharma, sharing intimate moments on social media.  Kohli recently made a return to India‚Äôs premier domestic one-day competition for the first time in 15 years and made an immediate impact. Kohli struck scores of 131 and 77 in successive innings, reaffirming his class and enduring hunger for runs.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
content: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

title: Drone attack on Crimea hotel? At least 24 killed; Russia blames Ukraine
content: Russia claims a Ukrainian drone strike killed at least 24 people and injured over 50 at a hotel and caf√© in occupied Kherson during New Year celebrations. This follows Russia's accusation of a "terrorist act" targeting President Putin's residence, which Ukraine denies.

title: Ashes: Australia announce squad for fifth Test - Khawaja retained, no Cummins
content: Australia has revealed their 15-member squad for the final Ashes Test in Sydney, with Steve Smith captaining again. Pat Cummins is rested to manage his workload ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup. Usman Khawaja retains his spot despite a mixed series. The team aims to bounce back after their recent defeat.

title: Apple‚ÄìAdobe hiring war; Steve Jobs sends angry email - ‚ÄòOne of us must change‚Äô
content: In 2005, Steve Jobs confronted Adobe CEO Bruce Chizen over alleged poaching of Apple employees. Jobs believed in a non-recruiting agreement, while Chizen proposed a senior-level exception. The exchange ultimately led to an agreement to avoid actively soliciting employees from either company.

title: Pan India kidney racket exposed: Police names doc in organ trade; int'l links probed
content: Chandrapur police have busted a pan-India kidney trafficking ring with international ties, implicating two specialist doctors from Delhi and Trichy. The racket, involving illegal transplants in India and abroad, was exposed by a debt-ridden farmer. Investigations reveal a well-organized network of agents, donors, and hospitals, with transplants priced between ‚Çπ50 lakh and ‚Çπ80 lakh.

title: Indore water contamination deaths: Born after 10 years, family loses 6-month-old son
content: A six-month-old boy, born after a decade-long wait, has tragically died in Indore, allegedly due to contaminated drinking water. The infant developed severe symptoms, leading to his death. Chief Minister Mohan Yadav visited affected hospitals, ordered compensation for the deceased's family, and announced free treatment for all. Officials have been suspended and dismissed following the incident.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper to be launched in January! Check fares, route & other details
content: The first Vande Bharat sleeper train will run between Guwahati and Kolkata, Ashwini Vaishnaw announced on Thursday. Each Vande Bharat sleeper train has 16 coaches. The composition of the coaches is: 11 AC 3-tier, 4 AC 2-tier, and one AC 1st coach. The train can accommodate 823 passengers.

title: Feb 1 GST hit: Cigarette, bidi, pan masala to attract 40% tax ‚Äî check details
content: Starting February 1, tobacco and pan masala products will face new taxes. The government is introducing additional excise duties and a health cess, replacing the existing GST compensation cess. Pan masala will be taxed at 40% GST plus a new cess, while biris will attract 18% GST.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection vs 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'
content: Aditya Dhar's espionage thriller 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal run, crossing THIS amount on its 28th day.  Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's rom-com 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' has faltered, earning less than Rs 30 crore by its eighth day, failing to gain traction despite the Christmas holiday.

title: BSNL offers WiFi calling nationwide ‚Äî No additional cost, no third-party apps & more
content: BSNL has launched its Voice over Wi-Fi (VoWiFi) service nationwide from January 1, 2026, enabling subscribers to make and receive calls and messages over any Wi-Fi network at no extra cost. This initiative aims to enhance call quality and reliability, particularly in indoor and remote areas with limited mobile coverage, while also reducing network congestion.

title: UP: Drunk masked man in Bijnor holds minor at knifepoint, demands Rs 1L & bike; arrested
content: A 24-year-old man held a minor girl hostage at knifepoint in a Najibabad clothing shop. He demanded Rs 1 lakh and a motorcycle. Police arrived swiftly and rescued the girl. The man, who appeared intoxicated, was apprehended. He stated he wanted to go to jail. Further investigation is underway.

title: Indore water contamination deaths: Probe exposes major lapses; residents told to avoid tap water
content: Seven deaths have been reported in Indore's Bhagirathpura following a water contamination incident, with 162 patients hospitalized. A probe revealed a newly constructed toilet dumping waste directly above a loose joint in the main water supply pipeline, causing the contamination. Authorities are flushing the system and providing alternative water sources.

title: Esha Deol pays tribute to late father Dharmendra as she rings in New Year 2026
content: Esha Deol celebrated New Year's Eve in Dubai, dedicating a heartfelt tribute to her late father, Dharmendra, by posing with the moon and a touching note.  Her brother, Bobby Deol, shared his love in the comments.  This comes as Dharmendra's final film, 'Ikkis,' a war biopic, releases today, marking his last performance and leaving a precious memory for fans.

title: 'He is not knocking on the door': Ashwin's bold message to CSK on Sarfaraz ahead of IPL 2026
content: Sarfaraz Khan brought up his hundred in just 56 balls in what was a breathtaking knock. Ashwin also highlighted the batter‚Äôs performances in the recently concluded Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT), where he amassed 329 runs in seven matches at a strike rate of 203.08 and an average of 65.80.

title: Tragic: Sikandar Raza's brother passes away at 13; Zimbabwe star posts emotional message
content: Raza himself responded to the tragic news on social media, sharing a broken heart emoji beneath Zimbabwe Cricket‚Äôs condolence message. The personal loss comes at a demanding phase in Raza‚Äôs professional career. He was last seen in action for the Sharjah Warriorz during the ILT20 2025, where he featured in 10 matches, scoring 171 runs and picking up 10 wickets.

title: What next for Neerja Modi School after CBSE withdrawal; long road for reaffiliation
content: CBSE has withdrawn the affiliation of Neerja Modi School, Jaipur following a fatal fall of a Class IV student and findings of serious safety violations. The decision affects students, parents, and staff, with new admissions barred and several classes required to shift schools. While senior students may complete Board exams, the school faces a long and conditional path towards possible reaffiliation after strict compliance with CBSE safety norms.

title: Indian-origin Mamdani sworn in as New York City first Muslim mayor at historic subway station ‚Äî watch
content: Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani was sworn in as New York City's first Muslim mayor early Thursday, beginning a four-year term. The 34-year-old Democrat took the oath at the City Hall subway station, with a larger public ceremony to follow. Mamdani, known for his left-leaning views, previously served in the New York State Assembly.

title: Ukraine drone plot against Putin: US intelligence rejects Russian claim ‚Äî What the CIA says
content: The CIA has refuted Russia's claim that Ukraine attempted to attack President Vladimir Putin's residence, a statement echoed by US officials. President Trump, initially troubled by the accusation, later acknowledged a lack of confirmation. This incident follows a meeting between Trump and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, where progress on peace talks remained limited.

title: Ram‚Äôs ideals guided Operation Sindoor: Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh stated India acted with Lord Ram's ideals during Operation Sindoor, drawing inspiration from his virtues and role in vanquishing the wicked. He highlighted the Ram Janmabhoomi movement as a significant, centuries-long struggle that shaped society and laid foundations for the future.

title: Smriti shares cryptic Gita quote in year-end post after calling off wedding
content: As 2025 drew to a close, Smriti Mandhana took to Instagram on December 31 to share a recap video of the year gone by. The video featured glimpses of her World Cup-winning celebrations, cherished moments with her family, and snippets from her fitness routine. What stood out, however, was the quote she chose to end the video with‚Äîa line attributed to Lord Krishna from the Bhagavad Gita.

title: 'Impossible targets': Riders flag unsafe roads, shrinking earnings ‚Äî what triggered gig workers' protest
content: Delivery workers across India observed a New Year's Eve strike protesting low pay and lack of social security, despite app-based platforms offering festive bonuses. While many customers remained unaware, several orders faced significant delays. Platforms like Swiggy and Zepto increased per-order pay, but some workers refused the incentives, citing unachievable targets and the risk of ID blocking.

title: Mumbai receives surprise morning showers on 1st day of 2026
content: Mumbaikars welcomed the New Year 2026 with unexpected heavy showers and drizzle across several parts of the city on Thursday morning. The unseasonal rains, which began shortly before 6 am and gradually reduced, made the weather pleasant for many residents. Social media users shared their surprise and appreciation for the beautiful, albeit unusual, weather.

title: CBSE to train teachers for mandatory skill education from Jan 5: Check key details
content: CBSE will begin one-day, offline Capacity Building Programmes (CBPs) from January 5, 2026 to train teachers and school leaders for mandatory Skill Education in Classes 6‚Äì8, using NCERT‚Äôs Kaushal Bodh activity books. The move advances NEP 2020‚Äôs early skills vision. Here‚Äôs the schedule, key venues and what schools must implement‚Äîtimetable hours, projects, assessment and the year-end Kaushal Mela.

title: Stock market outlook 2026: Where are Sensex & Nifty headed? Top things to know
content: Indian equities lagged global markets in 2025 due to muted corporate earnings, FII selling, and missed AI rally. Despite touching record highs, broader market sentiment remained subdued. Experts anticipate a stronger 2026, driven by domestic growth, potential FII return, and improved valuations, with Nifty and Sensex targets set higher.

title: Who is Taylor McGregor? ESPN reporter earns praise during Hurricanes playoff game
content: Taylor McGregor received strong praise while covering the Miami Hurricanes‚Äô 10‚Äì3 playoff win over Texas A&M on Saturday. ESPN colleagues and fellow reporters applauded her work and presence on social media. McGregor continues to grow her profile at ESPN and MLB coverage, carrying forward a deep family connection to sports leadership.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: What's the outlook for New Year? Top things to know
content: Gold price prediction: According to Abhilash Koikkara of Nuvama Professional Clients Group, MCX Gold is expected to maintain its positive bias unless there is a clear and decisive break below the 132,000 support level.

title: Charity auction, Netanyahu among partygoers: Inside Trump and Melania‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago New Year‚Äôs Eve party
content: President Trump and First Lady Melania hosted their annual New Year's Eve party at Mar-a-Lago, with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu among the high-profile guests. Trump's New Year's resolution was "Peace on Earth." The event included a charity auction where a painting sold for $2.75 million.

title: 'We can't indulge in idol worship': Actor Nushrratt Bharuccha's Mahakal visit sparks row
content: Bollywood actor Nushrratt Bharuccha's visit to Mahakaleshwar Temple and participation in Hindu rituals has drawn a fatwa from Maulana Mufti Shahabuddin Razvi Bareilvi. The religious leader stated her actions contravene Sharia, calling it a grave sin for a practicing Muslim. Bharuccha described her visit as "beautiful" and "deeply meaningful."

title: Anjel Chakma murder: Dehradun SSP open to adding racial-slur charge
content: Dehradun police are now open to new statements regarding alleged racial slurs in the Anjel Chakma murder case, after initially dismissing the angle. The victim's family claims attackers used derogatory terms, leading to the fatal assault. Police are investigating, focusing on identifying the last absconding accused. The victim's brother has requested privacy to grieve.

title: Water contamination kills 7: Crowned cleanest city 8 times, Indore now faces tap-water crisis
content: Contaminated drinking water has led to a severe outbreak of diarrhoea and vomiting in Indore's Bhagirathpura area, resulting in at least seven deaths and over 1,100 residents falling ill. Officials have acknowledged lapses, leading to the suspension of several municipal corporation employees. The incident has raised serious questions about civic oversight despite the city's 'cleanest city' reputation.

title: 'Dreams don't come true that quickly': Sarfaraz Khan after blistering 157 off 75 balls
content: Batting at No. 4, Sarfaraz Khan blasted nine fours and 14 sixes, bringing up his hundred off just 56 balls. His innings left Goa‚Äôs bowlers and fielders looking shellshocked. On Wednesday, he delivered it with a sledgehammer, scoring a blistering 157 off 75 balls to power Mumbai to a 87-run victory over Goa at the Jaipuria Vidyalaya Ground.

title: Two friends killed: Ex-boxing champion Anthony Joshua survives fatal car crash - Watch
content: Joshua was tr‚Äãavelling on Monday with Sina Ghami and Latif Ayodele on a busy highway linking Lagos and Ibadan in southwestern Nigeria when their SUV crashed into a stationary truck. The Traffic Compliance and Enforcement Agency (TRACE) in Ogun state, where the accident occurred, said preliminary investigations showed the vehicle suffered a tyre burst before ramming into the truck.

title: Rupee enters New Year 2026 in red: Falls 11 paise to 89.99 against US dollar
content: The Indian Rupee began 2026 on a weak footing, depreciating significantly against the US dollar due to sustained foreign fund outflows and trade uncertainties. Despite India's steady growth, capital flows have faltered, making the rupee vulnerable. Analysts anticipate continued volatility, with the currency facing pressure from global investor caution and tariff disruptions.

title: Bank holidays in 2026: When will banks remain closed in January? Check list
content: Banks across India will observe several closures in January 2026 due to national and regional holidays. Several states will see bank branches shut on dates ranging from January 2nd to January 26th, with Republic Day impacting most of the country. Customers are advised to plan physical transactions in advance, as digital services remain accessible.

title: 'New normal': India's 2025 'zero-tolerance' doctrine pushed terror outfits & Pak to sidelines
content: India's national security adopted a harder stance in 2025 following the brutal Pahalgam massacre. Prime Minister Modi declared a 'Yuddha' against terror, leading to Operation Sindoor, a significant counteroffensive targeting terror infrastructure deep inside Pakistan and PoK. Diplomatic and military actions were taken to hold Pakistan accountable for cross-border terrorism.

title: NFL futures: Seattle Seahawks enter Week 18 as Super Bowl favorites
content: Through 17 weeks of the NFL season, the  Seattle Seahawks  are the new favorites to win the Super Bowl 60, following the  Los Angeles Rams 's loss on "Monday Night Football." The Rams drop to second, as three NFC West teams sit in the top four. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl at +700. The  San Francisco 49ers  at +850 and the AFC East champion  New England Patriots  at +900. The Seahawks and 49ers meet in Week 18. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

content: Zachariah Branch puts Georgia up 3 scores with a 13-yard receiving touchdown . the former USC receiver and his brother, Zion, entered the transfer portal in 2024 . "he made me aware of him," coach Kirby Smart said .

title: No more Exit 30: Davidson renames historic exit after Stephen Curry
content: Stephen Curry is renamed Stephen Curry Interchange for his contributions to the school's men's basketball program . the star has worn the number 30 throughout his college and the pro career . he wore his Davidson sweatsuit along with a pair of "Carmine" Air Jordan Retro 6's .

title: 'Need this on my fridge': Bucs TEs' festive Christmas cards lost in mail
content: two Tampa Bay Buccaneers teammates posted a series of hilariously awkward holiday photos on Instagram . the two were seen wearing matching head-to-toe outfits and striking an assortment of cheesy poses in front of a Christmas tree . no players were injured attempting the stunt .

title: Which NBA star had the best year? The 2025 Golden Basketball goes to ...
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder are 1-2 again in the first installment of the MVP straw poll conducted by ESPN's Tim Bontemps . Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Nikola Jokic of the Denver Nuggets battled for MVP of the 2024-25 regular season .
